headline.kicker: WHAT'S NEW IN CORPORATE YOUTH PROGRAMS
headline.main: To Build for Tomorrow, Take Care of Babies Today

byline.original: By Lisa H. Towle; Lisa H. Towle is a writer based in New Jersey

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As a member of the National Commission to Prevent Infant Mortality, created by Congress in 1987, Senator Bill Bradley, a Democrat from New Jersey, is part of a broad-based effort to link boardrooms with babies. ''Our national productivity is threatened unless we act now to foster the healthy development of our children,'' he said recently.
